attributes.action: Mandatory installation of 2 Electric car charging points at fuel stations
attributes.additional_details:
The cost of petrol is rising and is only going to get astronomically higher, with a weakening pound and fluctuating markets. Electric powered cars are here but the infrastructure to charge an electric car isn't.
Lets get Parliament to debate whether passing a law to force filling stations 'nationwide' to install a minimum of 2 electric charging points is a good idea, so we can all enjoy 3p a mile instead of £1.35 a litre.
